results.title: 'Servent' solves a problem
results.creator_credit: Factual Films of Australia and Ivor P. Kershaw
results.brief_description: A demonstration of how a newly-developed system of wiring between your house and the main electricity supply may be used to eliminate unsightly masses of wires between your home and the poles in the street. (Sponsored by Olympic Cables.)

results.title: 'Screen It' 2013 [finalists and winning entries]
results.brief_description: ‘Screen It’ is ACMI’s nation-wide annual competition for Primary and Secondary School students. In 2013, the theme of “connect” drew entries from every state and territory in Australia. The entries in this compilation are the winners in each category, encompassing the best in live action, animation and videogames, best overall entries and the winners of the ‘Bullying. No Way!’ prize.

results.title: 'Rockthorpe' Tasmania.
results.brief_description: The story of the production of breeding ewes and rams required to maintain high quality Australian wool. Fifty years of experience at “Rockthorpe” stud farm in Tasmania, have produced the Polwarth sheep - a breed suited to both coastal and highland conditions. Shows how the use of a fleec measurement system, individual classification, and selection of breeding-stock brings outstanding results.

results.title: 'Rivers of fire': an eruption of Hawaii's Mauna Loa Volcano
results.creator_credit: Hawaii Natural History Association, United States. National Park Service, Kathleen English, Jon Erickson and Les Malzman
results.brief_description: Examines the twenty two day eruption of Mauna Loa, the world’s largest volcano which started on 25 March 1984. Explains the Hawaiian volcanoes with spectacular photography within a well structured presentation which includes excellent graphics of plate tectonics and the hot spot theory.
results.title_for_label: ‘Rivers of fire’: an eruption of Hawaii’s Mauna Loa Volcano

results.title: 'M' (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Nero-Film, Seymour Nebenzal and Fritz Lang
results.brief_description: A classic German Expressionistic film, Peter Lorre in his greatest role portrays a psychotic child molester - a pathetic vagabond figure, who experiences a frenzy at the sight of tender young school girls, and try as he may, is unable to control the fervour of his criminal inclinations. The police disregard his letters of confession to them as the work of a lunatic. Rated: M

results.title: 'Justice' of the Red functionaries
results.brief_description: Inspired and colourful narration accompanies this montage of German propaganda designed to illustrate the worst tyrannies of a Soviet State. Shows the administration of justice in 1948 as applied under Ulbricht’s communist regime. Includes pictures taken in Soviet zonal courts, and interviews with judges who fled to the West. An example of cold-war era red-scare demagoguery.

results.title: 'Estampa flamenca'
results.creator_credit: Dave Ellis Films and Dave Ellis
results.brief_description: This film features Maria Benitez, one of the world’s great flamenco dancers, in rehearsal and performance in her native New Mexico. She discusses the Gypsy and Spanish origins of flamenco with members of her dance company, Estampa Flamenca. Narrated by Jose Rodriguez

results.title: 'Endeavour'
results.brief_description: H.M.N.Z.S. Endeavour takes the New Zealand party for the British Trans-Antarctic Expedition to the Antarctic. Members of the party carry out oceanographic research, help build Scott Base and restore Scott’s and Shackleton’s huts before the ship brings Sir Vivian Fuchs, Sir Edmund Hillary and other expedition members back to New Zealand

results.title: 'E'
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Robert Forget and Brent Walker Film Productions
results.brief_description: Under the guise of a pretty fairy tale, this animated film makes a strong political statement. Paper cut-outs enact a drama in which a dictator, suffering from a visual defect which affects his perception of things, imposes his delusions on his unfortunate subjects. The humour is black and despite an absence of dialogue the message is clear. (Awards: Berlin, Cracow, Zagreb, Gijon, Barcelona, New York)

results.title: 'Colleges classiques' in Quebec
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Leonard Forest and Pierre Patry
results.brief_description: Founded on a study of the humanities, the classical colleges of Quebec have no exact counterpart elsewhere. This film explores their origins and shows how the classics still open the door to the wisdom of the ages. However, changes are being introduced, including greater emphasis on the sciences.
